meanings.definition: The state or quality of being windy.
meanings.sent1: The windiness outside made the trees sway gently.
meanings.sent2: I love the fresh air and windiness by the beach.
meanings.sent3: The windiness in the park made the kite fly high in the sky.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter filled the room with a light windiness.
meanings.sent5: The windiness of the storm was so strong it blew off the roof tiles.

meanings.definition: The presence of wind or air currents.
meanings.sent1: The windiness in the valley created a soothing sound.
meanings.sent2: Sailors rely on windiness to move their boats across the ocean.
meanings.sent3: The windiness in the room made the curtains dance gracefully.
meanings.sent4: The windiness of the storm carried the scent of rain and earth.
meanings.sent5: The windiness of the desert sandstorm was relentless and blinding.

meanings.definition: The tendency to talk at length without saying anything important.
meanings.sent1: Her speech was filled with unnecessary windiness that bored the audience.
meanings.sent2: The politician's windiness made it hard to understand his true intentions.
meanings.sent3: Despite his windiness, he never actually answered the question.
meanings.sent4: The windiness of his stories left everyone confused and uninterested.
meanings.sent5: Her windiness in conversation was like a never-ending breeze of words.
